meaning_str.bing:
n. 投票；表决；选举；选票
v. 选举；提议；选出；建议
网络. 表决权；投票权

投票；选票；表决；选举；投票权；选举权；表决权；得票数；投票结果；选举结果；表决结果
投票表决；投票支持；投票反对；投票决定；投票通过；投票否决；投票同意；选举；表决；提议；表达意见；行使选举权；主张；建议；选出；推举（某人担任某职）

1.en: He said he was not told when elections will be held or when an anticipated election law governing the vote will be announced.
1.cn: 他说，他没有被告知大选日期，以及何时宣布人们期待的选举法。

2.en: Election activity has surged in the past few days with both major parties trying to motivate their supporters to vote.
2.cn: 选举活动在过去几天开始升温，两大政党都在试图动员他们的支持者投票。

3.en: Mr Cheng's backing is likely to be seen as a vote of confidence in London's already booming property market.
3.cn: 郑家纯的支持可能被看成是对已经很繁荣的伦敦地产市场投出的一张信任票。

0.en: Cary, we don't decide until we vote.
0.cn: 凯里，我们投票之后才能决定。

1.en: Shouldn't we all vote on stuff like this?
1.cn: 这种事我们总要投票解决吧？

2.en: Ridiculous. Sheldon, I vote that is not a tangent.
2.cn: 太荒谬了。谢尔顿，我投票，这不是带偏题。

3.en: Granted, but Edmunds' data is more promising. We should vote.
3.cn: 有道理，但是Edmunds的数据前景更好。我们应该投票。

4.en: And when it got a vote earlier this year. Republicans flat-out voted "no".
4.cn: 当今年早些时候有一个投票的机会。共和党人断然投票反对。

5.en: We didn't vote. We didn't have to, that was clearly a tangent. Now come on. Back to work.
5.cn: 我们还没有投票呢。不必投票，你明显是带偏话题了，快点，继续工作。

6.en: I'm urging these governors to consolidate their polling sites and create quote, unquote "voting centers" so that people feel safe to come out and vote.
6.cn: 我督促这些州长合并投票站建立"投票中心"这样民众会觉得出门投票是安全的。

7.en: Are you flexing? I'm stalling until the House vote happens and then the Senate votes accordingly.
7.cn: 你在耍滑头吗？我想拖到众议院完成投票，好让参议院据结果投票。

8.en: Thank you. Thank you. We will now vote on the resolution. Ladies and gentlemen, please cast your vote.
8.cn: 谢谢各位。谢谢，现在就方案进行表决，女士们，先生们，请投票。

9.en: I think it'll be pretty clear. If not, we'll take a vote.
9.cn: 我想很容易判断吧，如果模棱两可就投票决定。

10.en: We want to assure anyone who's considering not voting that it is not only safe to vote, it is your duty to do so.
10.cn: 我们希望任何在考虑不投票的各位知道现在投票不仅是安全的，更是你们的责任。

11.en: And whether they vote for me or not, I have to lead them as well.
11.cn: 不管他们是不是为我投票，我也得带领他们。

12.en: The vote isn't until tomorrow afternoon. I'll reach out to Mendoza.
12.cn: 明天下午才开始投票，我一早就会联系Mendoza。

13.en: So that's how it'll be? Fight to the death? No. We vote.
13.cn: 所以这就是事情的发展方向吗？针锋相对，互不相让吗？不，我们投票。

14.en: I'm a partner. You want to remove me, you need the majority vote of the executive board, and then you need a vote of the full board.
14.cn: 我是个合伙人，你想开除我，你需要执行委员会的多数票，然后你需要正式合伙人投票。

15.en: First of all, the vote is never gonna get to the Senate. It's a senseless partisan circus.
15.cn: 首先，投票就不会进入参议院。这只是毫无意义的党争闹剧。

16.en: I'm here to ask a favor. I want you to call for a vote. Project Insight has to be delayed.
16.cn: 我来找你帮个忙，我想请你发动一次投票，洞察计划必须得推迟。

17.en: The House is about to vote, Donald. What is going on? Let's get this done so you can go home.
17.cn: 众议院即将投票，唐纳德。怎么回事？我们把这事弄完，你就能回家了。

18.en: Move the anti-filibuster measure forward so the Senate can vote and elect me vice president. No. No?
18.cn: 推进抗阻挠措施，好让参议院能投票选我担任副总统。不行。不行？

19.en: Well, if we're going to vote, there's something you should know. Brand? He has a right to know.
19.cn: 好吧，要是投票的话，有件事你应该要知道，Brand，他有权知道。
